Key Match Events: The Kansas City Royals lost Game 4 of the ALDS to the New York Yankees with a score of 3-1.
Bobby Witt Jr. scored in the sixth inning of Game 4.
Aaron Judge and Giancarlo Stanton produced an insurance run in the top of the sixth inning.
Kyle Isbel hit a 98 mph fastball that almost tied the game but fell short, landing in Juan Soto's glove.
Michael Wacha started Game 4 and permitted two runs over 4 2/3 innings.
Post-Match Reflections: Bobby Witt Jr. expressed his desire to be in the Yankees' position, celebrating a series victory.
Witt mentioned that the experience will motivate the Royals for future postseason appearances.
Michael Wacha expressed disappointment, feeling that the Royals should still be playing.
Maikel Garcia highlighted the team's improvement from losing 100 games last year to making the playoffs this year.
Manager Matt Quatraro acknowledged the team's higher expectations and the disappointment of the loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Royals had a significant improvement from 106 losses in 2023 to 86 wins in 2024.
This was the first time since 1984 that a Kansas City playoff appearance ended before the World Series.
The Royals became the first team in MLB history to win a postseason series a year after losing 100 games.
The game was affected by a cross-wind measured at 6 mph.
Others: Bobby Witt Jr. is seen as an ascending superstar for the Royals.
Catcher Salvador Pérez will return for another year.
Starting pitchers Cole Ragans and Seth Lugo will headline the rotation next year.
Michael Wacha has a player option to become a free agent.
